content:
I can recommend the following resources and tools that may help you improve your public speaking skills:

1. toastmasters international: toastmasters is a non-profit organization that offers a supportive environment for individuals to improve their public speaking skills. guests can attend meetings for free to observe or participate. 2. ted talks: ted talks are informative and inspiring videos where experts share their insights and experiences. these talks can help you learn from some of the most accomplished speakers and performers, and may give you ideas for your own presentations. 3. video recording: video recording your presentations can be a helpful way to review your performance and identify areas for improvement. 4. public speaking books: there are many books available on public speaking that cover techniques ranging from building confidence, to speaking effectively, to planning and delivering presentations. 5. online courses: there are various online courses available that cover topics like effective communication skills, public speaking, and presentation skills. remember, becoming a great public speaker requires consistent practice and dedication. by utilizing these resources and tools, you can continue to improve your skills and feel confident in your ability to speak effectively in front of any audience.
